mods.abstract: Committed. To the Jail in the city of Shreveport, parish of Caddo, negro man of black color, aged about 35 years, to upper front teeth out, about five feet five inches high, calls his name CHARLES, and says he belongs to Judge Hooker, Hunt county, Texas. Said boy was riding a bay hourse about six years old and said he stole the horse from a campmeeting ground near his owners home. Also ,a negro man of yellow color, about twenty four years of age, about five feet 8 inches high, and says he also belongs to Judge Hooker, calls his name NELSON, he was also riding a small brown mare about seven years old, which he also stole at the same time and place as above stated, owners of animals names unknown. The owner or owners of said horses can find and obtain the same by applying to Col. S. D. Pitts, near Mooringsport, Caddo parish, La., by proving property and paying charges. The owner or owners of the said slaves are hereby notified to come forward prove property, pay charges and take them away or they will be disposed of as the law directs. J.W. MAHLE, Jailor. Oct. 25-3t
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
